Entry.1:
(First day at Sea)

Left 2.30 after about 6 hours without any grub & feeling pretty sick of everything & everybody. Ship pretty crowded with troops from elsewhere. Result- anywhere you can get. On the whole a nice ship with quarters & conditions not objectionable to the critical. Easy sea, steady ship. Developed Sick headache from want of grub. Was sick & much relieved toward nightfall. Turned in without any tea after a sleep on the deck through the mess time of about an hour.
Entry.3: day at sea. Sea calm. Felt well. Comforts handed out. Had hair cut by Norman Walker. Getting colder as we go South. Slept well in hammock. Had game of 500.
Entry.5: day at Sea. Struck head wind & rough sea. Not sick
Entry.7:
Day at sea, Sea easy. Infantryman buried at sea with Union jack & full military rites. 8th day from Sydney. Arrived Fremantle 6 a.m. Good weather. Hot & sultry. Steamer granted . General shore 

6. Case Meningitis on board. Everyone on board douched & throat-painted. Same thing next day. Picked up Leeuwin Lighthouse. Good run up coast to Fremantle. 
 Pi
Entry.8: Picked up "Argyllshire" off Leeuwin. Travelling slowly against head wind under one screw as one engine had broken down.
Entry.9:
"Argyllshire" arrived in the stream at Fremantle after we had gone ashore on leave.

8 Letters 1, 2 & 3 & 4 posted. No. 4 from Boat Censor & one written ashore.

8. leave granted from 9 am till 6 pm. Left steamer with Herb Larsen & Norman Walker at 10.15 & arrived at Fremantle station at 10.30 after going ashore in a motor launch.

Paid 1/- launch & train fare both ways. Left Fremantle for Perth in special train. Arrived Perth 10.50 am. Left Perth station for G.P.O. Perth. Arrived there & sent 
Letter Card &
 Telegram to Floris & Jim. Left G.P.O. & struck an Ice Cream shop. Had fruit Salad & ice cream. Wrote Letter Card to Floris & addressed Souvenir of Perth to Floris. Went back to G.P.O. & posted Letter Card & Souvenir to Floris. Went & had Dinner at Moana Café with Herb & Norman. Had a grill etc. enjoyed it. Left after Dinner & strolled round Perth. Went for Motor Drive round King’s Park. Took ½ an hour. Raining all the way nearly. Had glorious views of Perth & Swan River. Came back, strolled round. had Tea 

8. Bought provisions for Mess. Caught train (special) from Perth for Fremantle. Crowded. Lots of Infantry tanked. Douglas landed back injured. Taken into ship’s hospital. Caught launch from pier to steamer & arrived back on board at 6.45 pm tired but enjoyed the day. Wrote diary & turned in.

Called at Pavilion Theatre & saw Harry Crust. Shown over theatre. Promised to drop him a line.

Bought Khaki trousers (6/11) Khaki Shirt
Entry.10:
at Brennan Bros.

9. Left Fremantle at 4 pm. Great send off. Crowds lined the shore. Boats whistles, crowds cheered, soldiers on "Argyllshire" also cheered. Had singsong on Poop Deck at night. Rather rough sea.
Entry.11:
Fine day. Sea smooth. Did nothing in morning. Opened Comforts from Comforts Committee. Got cigarettes, Fruit, Biscuits, Milk, Jam etc in plenty. Gave 3 cheers to the 

10. Comforts Committee for them on the Poop deck on which they were opened. After having an enormous tea we all repaired to Poop deck where we had a good old sing song & sports, Cock-fighting, etc.
Entry.12: Did Sentry & Guard Duty on boat & watches. Spent 3 to 5 am in Canteen Flat post & had several visits from Mr. Rat. & learned Morse Code.
Entry.13: Service. Did not go on a/c of Guard Duty day before. Had service on Poop in afternoon. Big meeting on aft well-deck at night.
Entry.14:
Broke very windy cold & wet. No early parade. No parades all day. Sat on poop & played games & talked & joked all day. Didn’t feel too good but brightened towards evening.

11. 3rd Concert at night- Success. Did "Dandy Fifth" & "Ode to Kitchener."

Got 2 printed Souvenir programs which I will send home; autographed.

Rotten Luck

N.F.W.
 

 Mc	N.G.L	 
B.S.
Entry.15: Sea somewhat moderated on yesterday. Spent most of day practising Morse Code & watching teams train for Tug-o’-war competition tomorrow. Had a box with Norman. Have seen nothing at sea since leaving Fremantle.
Entry.16: Nice day. Sea Calm. Rose 6am. Parade 6.30. Physical Jerks till 7 am. B/fast 7.15. Parade 9.30. Morse till 10.30. Practise for sports. Afternoon. Sports. Tug-o-war & Boxing Contests. Engns. won most events. I did washing & had bath while events were on as did Norman. Had tea 5 p.m. Went on poop deck after tea. Had introduction in repelling submarine attack. Sent first Morse message to Norman since learning Morse alphabet. Saw school of Porpoises.
Entry.17:
Rose 6.a.m. Nice day. Sea like a mirror all day. No parades as it was washing day for Engrs. Having done mine on

Wednesday spent all day nearly, on poop behind one of the boats. Read "Souls in Pawn" & finished it. Good story, poorly written in parts. In afternoon went below and did some sewing & cleaned leggings & boots. While there a submarine warning was blown without warning & I donned my life belt & carried out customary instructions. Also spent ½ an hour writing Letter No 5 to Flo. After tea @ 5 pm went on deck & had games & talks & a sing song- Slept on poop for first time. Turned in about 9.30. p.m.
Entry.18: Usual events. Fine day. Sub. Warning.
Entry.19: Did Morse Code in morning. Then Norman & I were put on drilling holes in Girders in Hospital. Ship’s crew Concert at night. Didn’t go. Wrote letters instead.
Entry.20:
Did Guard-2nd time- several men went to sleep on posts.

20, 21, 22} Usual Routine & practice for sports.
Entry.21: Did signalling in morning- read a buzzer first time. In afternoon had a mock trial. Cpl Beard the accused & Spc Winterbottom plaintiff. Proved very funny. Sighted land at about 3 p.m. Arrived & anchored in Durban at 7 p.m. Rather a nice place. Sat on poop in evening & had sing-song. Turned in at 9.15 on poop.
Entry.22: Woke 5.a.m. rose & had wash & got ready for route march. Leave granted from 1.30 till 10.30 p.m. Route march from 9.30 till 12 noon. Left ship at 9.30 & lined up on the quay with other units Engrs leading. Had inspection by M.O. & then gave salute to O/C ship, as we turned on the road leaving wharf for Durban
Entry.23:
Route March led to the Ocean beach Esplanade. Told we were going for a swim which pleased us greatly as it was very hot & sultry & we were leathed in perspiration. The swim did not come off & proved to be a fiasco as the local Military Staff had not advised the manager of the intended visit of us & he was thus unable to accommodate us. Very disappointed we were marched back & broken off so as to get some refreshments. Had an iced ginger beer which was very welcome. After a short spell on the grass we returned to the ship which was reached at 12.30 without further incident. Had Dinner. Went on deck. Saw gun put on poop deck. Fell in again at 1.45 & marched from the quay to the Police Courts in Durban without the other units which followed at intervals. Dismissed after picket had been fallen in, and Woolley & I hired a Ricksha from there to the ocean baths which cost us 1/- each. Got to baths at 3 p.m. Had a nice surf swim & a shower which was

24 the first time I had felt really clean since leaving Sydney. After leaving baths we took a Ricksha again to town to the Royal Hotel where Tim Woods, Woolley, Geo. Mathison, Cameron, Tom Peters & I all had afternoon tea. First decent cup of tea since leaving Perth. After having our afternoon tea we all had a roam round the City looking at & buying souvenirs etc. Curios quite out of question as regards price. In fact it costs 5/- to open your mouth in Durban almost. After posting letters to Flo & Souvenir also at G.P.O. we caught a Marriett Rd tram to the Zoo Gardens & enjoyed the run out on the top of the double decker. After reaching the garden we all had a drink at the Kiosk & returned by another route giving lovely views of the city from the heights at the rear of the city. Came into town again to Police station & met Herb Larsen & waited an hour for Norman Walker but not turning up we all went to the Royal for Dinner for which

24. We were all ready. & after a wash we all sat down & had a great feed. After leaving the Royal, Herb & Woolley & I went round the town while Herb bought Xmas Cards to send home & there being none worth buying I decided to leave mine till I got to the Cape. Met Walker at 8.30 in front of G.P.O. & arranged to meet him again at 9 after he had a bath. Met him at 9 & got into a cheap restaurant- which was the best our tired legs could find- & Norman & Len Bowkett had their & I had 2 glasses of milk & felt fit to bust when we emerged from the place ready to make our way to the boat. We then had a final Ricksha Ride for 1/2 an hour & after Herb buying some fruit which was greedily disposed of we caught a tram to the "point" & reached the steamer again at 10.40 turned in & went to sleep ere long after a most happy day’s fun on the whole.
Entry.24: Still in Durban. No leave. Sat on poop & watched coaling till noon. Had dinner & when we had finished went up to find we were making for sea. Got out & found a very heavy swell running. Watched pilot leaving. Sighted the Dutch steamer "Sonors" off Durban.
Entry.25: Swell still running but fine. Went to Church service morning & night.
Entry.26: Sea calm, sighted steamer on coast side
Entry.27:
Fine day, sighted S. African coast & mountains. Entered Table Bay before breakfast. Tied up at wharf at 9 am. Took water & provisions on. No leave granted at Cape Town. Picket sent ashore. Larsen & Walker went with them. They had a swim. Walker went in with his watch on. We all sat on deck & watched proceedings on wharf & looked round & had a bird’s eye view of the city at a few miles distance. Struck with the beauty & rugged grandeur

28 of the city of Cape Town’s background which rises straight up as a range of rugged peaks to a height of 3-4000 ft. 2 pm. Pulled out from wharf into stream. Coal lighters came alongside. Watched man catching young sharks from the ship’s side. Found the day warm & balmy but a great improvement after the heat of Durban. Had Tea & after T the Colonel gave a Concert to some of his friends from shore. Gave "Gung a Din" & "How the Chestnut Horse came Home." Well received. During Concert H.M.S. Kent (our convoy) & "Argyllshire" arrived in port. Then turned in on the deck as usual & went to sleep. Reason of leave not being granted was that men from the "Boona" played up while there & sickness on board our vessel.
Entry.28:
Fine & lovely day. Cape Town looks very pretty especially with all the vessels in 1 stream. Argyllshire steamed into 1 quay for water. Rose 6 am as usual & looked around until 7.30 when we went to breakfast.

Had throats swabbed as a precaution against
Entry.29: 29. Meningitis & other troubles. Also a Formalin tablet 3 times today for the same thing. Did not get leave today & stayed on board. Our Coy did guard & supplied fatigues. I was on Baker & got a cake & some bread. Also saw sports on deck. Supposed to go into the apple-bobbing race, but not being on the spot the race was run without me. "Kent" moved to Docks for Coal. "Argyllshire" pulled out into stream again. Bought Souvenir of Cape Town & peninsula for Floris, but not being allowed ashore, unable to post it.
Entry.30: Still in Cape Town in the stream. Nice day. Rose as usual at 6 am. Did jerks. Had breakfast. No parades. Did jerks & physical culture under Bill Allan’s direction for about an hour. Then read "Ginger Mick" to the boys on the deck at the Group’s request. Much speculation & thousands of latrine wirelesses as to leaving. Fed up of being in port & not going ashore. Hope to sail in the morning on our.
Entry.31:
‘16

30 last long spell of travelling. Big storm coming at time of writing this. Cleaned up knives & scissors with emery etc on account of rust. Got an orange in a scramble on the deck this morning which were given out by the Y.M.C.A. George Ravell made a defaulter through handing a letter to a coal lumper which contained information which were contrary to Military Orders. Given 10 days C.B.
Entry.32:
Rose 6 am. Ship weighed anchor at 6.15. On our way at 6.30 am with H.M.S. Kent as our escort. Glad to leave Cape Town the more at not being allowed ashore. Argyllshire, Boonah, Marathon all in the one convoy.

2. Nothing unusual. Sea still moderate. No concert. Travelling at night in darkness. Sub. warning in morning. Gun fired first time & shook hell out of the ship.
Entry.33: Church parade. Service conducted by Walter Willey. Nothing of any consequence. Sighted the "Ayrshire" on starboard side. Kent set out & spoke her & being satisfied to her nationality allowed her to pass on. Caused a little concern on board when first sighted on horizon. Service on Poop boat deck in afternoon. Had sing song. Madden taken ill with Meningitis. Condition critical today- I was awarded most popular entertainers prize of 10/- for last Concert.
Entry.34: Rose 6 am as usual. Spent an hour or two learning "Comrades in Arms" Quartette for Concert on
Entry.35: Nothing of importance happened saving that I had a bath (in a bucket as usual.).
Entry.36: Rose 6 am. Did Jerks etc. Spent most of morning on practising Quartette. Had Picture on Deck by Lt. Parkinson. After Dinner & the
Entry.37:
usual swabbing out we had usual jerks on 1 deck. Then had more practise & came on deck to watch sports practice. Duncan Woolley got hurt in wheelbarrow race with Jack L’Estrange. He fell on his neck & face & was badly bruised. After tea went on deck & spent the rest of the daylight in playing Quoits with the boys. Nothing startling happened today.

6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12} Nothing special. Smooth trip. All sorts of rumors. Received news of fall of Bukarest. with disgust. Entered tropics & felt off from the time we did so. Had touch of heat stroke.
Entry.38: Entered port again. Dropped anchor in Freetown, Sierra Leone, Africa 3 pm today. 12 transports in the bay. Some in
Entry.39: weeks. Expect to be here some time. Very hot & sultry in tropics. Long for the
Entry.40: cooler weather. Freetown is a very prettily situated place. It is built on the side of very high mountains which come right to the water front & away to the sky line as far as the eye can see.
Entry.41:
Leave granted 11.30 am to 4.30 pm on shore. Left ship in a barge after standing in the bottom of it – in the boiling sun- & sweating "till our bloomin’ eyebrows crawled". Reached & clambered on shore & was glad to catch some dirt again after about 3 weeks on the water. Found Freetown not what we thought it. It is not a modern town at all, as its appearance from the ship suggested but a dirty lot of old hovels infested with blacks of all grades & nationalities- but mostly low & immoral. In fact the natives here have no morals at all even from the children up although it does not strike one

14. as a pity for they seem so black as to be akin to the animal. At midday we hunted for a place to get a feed & not being able to do so went to one of the stores & bought some biscuits.

We, Tim Woods, Duncan Woolley, Herb & self (we having left Norman on the ship in hospital with a dose of Malaria) made our way to the Gardens, if such they can be called, & on our way thither bought some fruit & repaired- with our guide- into the gardens & had a rest & some eats after which we again made for town. Went to P.O & sent some P/cards to Flo, Cal & Jim of Freetown which were the best procurable. Then went through native quarter & had a good look round. Had a drink of English Lemonade at a native shop & the funny incident of the kid with the water running to get out of Tim’s road who was trying

14 to get a snap of him. After wandering round till we were full of it we again made for the quay- via the 2’6’’ gauge Railway Stn; Had a look at it. On reaching the quay we saw a Military Funeral of an Australian lad, the native soldier doing all the swank necessary. The coffin was made & supplied by the "Sympathetic Undertaker" of Kessiy St whose place we had passed previously in the afternoon. After purchasing some fruit & lining up we marched to the barges again where I took good care to get a side seat & then left the shore again for the ship, not a single man being sorry to leave the place where everything is taught the natives by the Church.
Entry.42: Our Coy being on duty no shore leave was given Engineers. Did the usual Bakery work which was all I did that day.
Entry.43: Our Unit supplied picket on shore for our boat but I was not in it. Did nothing all day except have the usual immersion in the afternoon.
Entry.44: Went Church 10.30. Nice service by Rev. Forsyth. The ship’s complement had to coal vessel. Engineers had first go. Made good fist of it. Mr Gray & Mr Dumas in it up to their necks. Was not picked so did not help. Did not feel too good & was rather glad. Day very hot. Men looked like niggers coming from coaling. Took Duncan’s photo while he was in this state. Norman discharged from hospital. Not too well.
Entry.45: Helped Coal ship in afternoon. Looked like Uncle Tom’s brother when I was through & felt as if I had
Entry.46:
18. ventured too far into the hot place. Got a bath & then was informed that a Concert party was to be sent off to the HMS Kent that evening in which I was included- in the Quartette. Left ship at 7.30 pm in Kent’s pinnace & had a lovely spin across the harbor. The party included Rice, Willey, Pates, Wilson, Cameron, Mathieson, 6 Stewards Adjutant & O.C. Troops of our ship. When once aboard we saluted the Quarter Deck & were taken by the Padre to the Officer’s smoking Room where drinks & smokes were dealt out in true naval fashion. After getting some smokes & booze into us we went on 1 Quarter Deck & the concert (program of which I have) began. The Quartette rendered "Dear Little Shamrock" & "Comrades in Arms". The programme was an excellent one & more cigarettes were put at

 20
 18. our disposal. After two-three hours entertainment which the Tars enjoyed- judging by the manner in which they cheered us after the conclusion of the program- we were again treated to drinks & cigarettes after which we again boarded the pinnace & set out for "Home" again whither we reached at 10.40 & thus ended one of the pleasantest evening’s enjoyment I have ever experienced.

 20
 19. Still hot. Duncan Woolley went into hospital with slight concussion of brain caused through his cranium becoming forcibly moved into contact with the hard deck whilst engaged in a wheelbarrow race with Jack Lestrange a week or two back. Concert party from "Kent" visited "Marathon" in return of our visit. Proved to be very enjoyable. Sat on Hatch for 2 ½ hours before it began 

 20
 19 in order to have a good seat & view of the performers. Got program of items. They also showed slides through a lantern. No items by any of the boys. Finale of their bill especially fine. Gave big cheers as they ended their bill at 10 pm.
Entry.47:
Nothing much doing today. Still no fresh water to wash in. Visited Duncan Woolley in Hospital & found him much improved. In afternoon Mr Gray gave us a French lesson. At Night the Kent’s band paid us a visit. Still as hot as hell itself.

21. Very hot still at Freetown. All on board were hoaxed today when the ship began to move forward under her own steam. Turned out to be only a move further out into the stream. Saw Duncan & found him much better. Had a
Entry.48: washing parade. Used rain water from last night’s big storm which I got out of one of the boats. Day went off much the same as usual.
Entry.49: Still at Sierra Leone. Very hot & sultry. All sorts of rumours about leaving. Wrote article for book on our Departure from Sydney. Saw Duncan again. Found him much better.
Entry.50: Duty Day. On Guard. Kept Anniversary in silence though thoughtful & with a mind full of impossible hope. Scratch Concert on Deck. Did 3 turns.
Entry.51:
Came off Guard. Very tired. Told we had to go to church. Rather annoyed. Got it over & got into few clothes & had dinner. In afternoon lay on deck. Eat Coconut & oranges. At night Quartette sang Adeste Fideles at church meeting on deck. Did not go round to sing Carols as was intended as we felt too tired after guard.

Coaling won by Engineer party. £2.
Entry.52:
Rose 6 am. Attended R.C. Service (Mass) to sing in Quartette Adeste Fideles. Had breakfast & then on deck. Church parades 10.30. Sang again at C of E & Other Denoms. Services. Had Dinner. Special- Pork, Peas, Yams. Fruit (shouted by our Officers) & Sago pudding which looked like a gathering storm but tasted O.K. We also had cigarettes given us by our O/C. Gave 3 cheers to O/C troops & Captain Jermyn. Also our officers.

H.M.S Swiftsure arrived today. Saluted her as usual.

King’s message read to troop prior to Church parade. 3 cheers given for His Majesty; on deck. Afternoon . Lay on Deck & slept.

Evening. Sang Comrades in Arms at Sacred Concert on deck.
Entry.53:
Rose as usual at 6 am. Had Breakfast & on parade at 9.30 as usual.

26. At 10.20 am anchor was raised & with "Kent" leading the way the Marathon & 3 other transports sailed out of Freetown Harbor. Met calm & tranquil sea. Nobody on board sorry to leave this hot shop of a place. Had hammock parade in afternoon. Morning & afternoon we had lectures on First Aid by Joe Fern. Very interesting. Had tea & after tea had to get our hammocks out without the aid of lights. Found the job inconvenient & rather annoying. Had game of 500 with Larsen, Mc Nab & Woods in Sergts Mess.
Entry.54: Parade as usual. Fine day. Saw tropical sunrise at sea. Very fine sight. Caught up with strange steamer making same way as us. Fell in with convoy.
Entry.55:
Weather much cooler. Feeling difference in change of 

28. longitude. Nothing special. Had lectures on points of the war gained since the outbreak by Mr. Gray.
Entry.56: Nice day. On warm side. Getting cooler. Fell in with a big convoy of 6 ships:- French cruiser, Orotava, Argyllshire, Boonah, Afric, Beltana which with us, Marathon, City of Sparta, Borda, Durham Castle & HMS Kent, made up, after much revolution for places, the entire convoy. After 11 am the Orotava turned away again towards Dacca. (Dakaa). Had lecture on General Engineering points in morning. Afternoon did some Morse signalling. Kent sent a party of men off to the Boonah. Evidently some trouble on her as the Kent turned right astern & made towards her. £2 won for coaling devoted towards defraying cost of the Souvenir. Won on a vote
Entry.57: Nothing important. Nice day. Still in the race home. Weather cooling now.
Entry.58: On Guard. 5th time. New Year’s Eve. Did duty on Officers’ Bar all thro’. They had concert for N.C.O’s in smoke room in evening & all hands there mole-o. In fact I was not impressed with the way things went. Their revels ceased toward 11 pm when I was relieved. Did not want to see the close of 1916. Thought of home & friends & love & all that was far away & went to sleep with a countenance more in sorrow than in jest.
Entry.59:
New Year’s Day. Came off Guard feeling very tired. Slept on deck part of morning & listened to lecture by Mr Gray the other part. The fact of being in a New Year did not trouble me

1. much but I wondered what all may be doing at home & wishing I was there. Turned in at 6.45 under Decks as we were running into a big storm & feared rain. Slept until 6.30 next morning.
Entry.60: Rose as usual 6.30 6.30. Rising hour changed to 6.30 on account of shortening daylight time. Started compiling Souvenir & made good progress. Willey, Lucas & self commenced to duplicate articles accepted for it so far. Accident to Engine on Starboard side. Fell back.
Entry.61:
Rose 6.30. Rather cold in early morning on deck. In fact getting cold right through the day now. Supposed to be parallel with Madeira Is today. Sighted a barque on port quarter on horizon making S.W. from the Baltic Sea. Still on Souvenir work. Ship’s mail closed for Australia. Sent cards to Jim

3. Flo, Cal & Deck by it promising to write fully on arrival at home Had Sub-warning call. Sentry put hole in lifeboat through discharging his rifle. Slept on Deck. Cold.
Entry.62: Revielle long before daybreak. In fact 2 hours late. After breakfast went on deck & found old Dawn just breaking his way through the darkness. Cold morning. Kept so throughout the day. Did more work to Souvenir. Weather getting dull- light rain this evening. Had rehearsal in Smoke-Room for Saturday’s Concert. Wrote letter to Flossie.
Entry.63: Nothing special. Weather still cooling. Feeling Good. Sleeping below again.
Entry.64: Still on Souvenir. Same as usual. Nothing out of the way.
Entry.65: Our Duty Day again. On Guard. Got out of it for Mass. Made Colonel’s Orderly with Lucas, spent all day on Souvenir. Wet & dull & cold on deck all day. Real Winter. 5.30 pm. Fell in with Convoy of destroyers (as per ) just on Dusk, nine or 10 in number. Made away with 3 "wasps" of the fleet & were soon well ahead 1 rest of 1 convoy. 9. p m. Barometer fell towards this hour & about that time we ran into a hurricane with wind from 60 – 80 miles an hour & as cold as ice. Bore it with patience. Got hot tea at 10.30 & 12.45 for the guard & then turned in in the orderly Room & slept (brokenly) till morning.
Entry.66:
Monday, Cold, wet, - windy- in fact everything that is nasty. Not a warm spot on the ship except under decks. Too rough to dismiss the Guard on Deck. Stood on the poop (under the lee, & watched the

antics of men endeavouring to walk the wet decks at intervals between the rolling of the ship. Many laughable scenes here took place. No parades this day. Packed our bags & ordered to make all preparation for disembarkation early on the morrow. Much joy at the thought of our long trip coming to an end at last. Had several strong blows & also sleet & hail on the deck throughout the day. 6.30 pm. Engines slowed down. Much speculation about cause. Re started at old speed in about ½ hour when we were again on our way North. Picked up Eddystone Light about this time on the Port Bow. Got 40 miles out of course this Gale. Missed H by a mile or two thro coming up with a Destroyer which came to Plymouth with us. Arrived Plymouth 11.30 pm. Asleep when we arrived.

Rose early & carried blankets forward to Store. Very cold morning. Tenders Sir Walter Raleigh & Sir Francis Drake
Entry.67:
came alongside 9.am. Left ship 10 am after carrying packages from AMC to tender. Gave cheers for boat, Captain & crew on leaving "Marathon" which they heartily returned. Arrived Devonport about 11 am. Got busy trucking stuff from pier to a store on water’s edge. This done bought & shared sweets & biscuits as this was all we could get to eat. Rations all packed up. Left by L & SW R Co train at noon & were soon on our way. Plenty of room & comfortable travelling with Walker, Field, Martin, Hetherington, Cockett, Robinson & Steel in our carriage. Arrived Exeter. Handed hot tea & Buns. Enjoyed them. Tea lasted (in water bottle) to end of journey. Solomon left at Salisbury. Arrived destination about 10. Made way per boot to Camp. Arrived in good time & hungry about 10.30 & after a lot of shifting about were shown to huts, issued with blankets & turned in without anything save a cup of tea after being without food since breakfast. Slept brokenly from 12 m/n

9. with Walker & was glad to get the chance of a rest as I was very tired. Guard left on our baggage at the station of Ainsworth(?) to watch it.
Entry.68: Rose 6.30. Breakfast at 7.am. Parade at 7.45. Very cold. Nearly froze. Ice & frost everywhere. Had route march about 3 miles & return along lovely country lanes. Had talk by our O/C Mr Gray on matters in general. & then returned to Camp for Dinner. Had it & then parade again. (G/A parade). Route March about 1 mile to get warm & used to climate. Solomon got into Camp. Got straw beds ready for Norman & I & then had a wash & tea. After tea, shaved & made for C of E hut where I wrote to Flo & the boys sending Ivy & holly to former. Then retired to hut & went thro bags & turned in.
Entry.69:
Revielle 6.30. Rose 7 a.m. ground covered with snow & as cold as hell. 

11. Camp very miserable. Had a talk w. Norman in sleep about the miniature Caledonian forest on the other side of a lake & woke up laughing. Raining on parade at 8 am. Dismissed & told to fall in in marching order at 11. Did so at 10 am. Marched to parade ground for about 2 hrs waiting for a Colonel to inspect us. He did come along about the same time that our feet froze. In fact the whole of our bodies were nearly the same way. After the inspection and a march past we were dismissed & went to dinner- glad to get in out of the ice & muck. Helped Tim Woods all 1 afternoon on Medical returns etc. Had Tea. Also Cold bath which again chilled the marrow in my bones & spent the rest of the evening shaving & cleaning up generally.
Entry.70:
Rose as usual. Snow on ground. Did not fancy washing much in the cold & dark. Had it just the same.

12. Fell in usual time. Cold as blazes. Spent all morning on Vacc. & Inve. Lists in Gray’s room with Tim Woods. After dinner. Raining & snowing. No parades blown. Everyone except us stayed in huts. We went for inoculation & got it with a vengeance. After it we went to our tents (huts). Did not take long for the dose to manifest itself. After tea had shave & not feeling too good went to bed at 6.45 & slept till morning.
Entry.71: Rose as usual- Crook arm, crook body- in fact all over. Went on parade & after inspection were marched to Orderly Room & dismissed for the day. After Dinner made bed & slept till tea. Had tea & then shaved & retired.
Entry.72:
Rose 6.30 Parade 8.30 Church till 10. Broke off. After Dinner went into Ludgershall. Saw Old Castle ruins built in 1100. Also church built in

14. 1320 wherein someone was burned in 1326 odd. Did not see it. Going another day. Had cup of Cocoa instead. Returned camp Had Tea & wrote Flo. Norman went over to old church in evening. Didn’t go with him. Wrote instead. Very cold day but fine.
Entry.73: Rose as usual. Cold morning. Route March in morning. Dental inspection in a/noon. Wrote letters to Dick & Cal at night.
Entry.74: Frosty morning. Route march-5M-in morning. Returned lame. Dinner. Route march again. returned damned near dead. Stayed in at night & wrote to Dick. Very cold.
Entry.75: Cold & frosty. Route march. Returned sore footed. afternoon. Engineers put on draft for Brightlingan. Got paid. Spent afternoon in Hut.
Entry.76:
Cold & dull as usual. Names taken for draft. Spent all day at this

18. & told we were to leave by train next morning. Aeroplane down in the Camp.
Entry.77: Revielle 5.30 B’fast 6. Fall in 7.am. with full gear. Stood ½ an hour on Parade ground & nearly froze. Marched off at 7.15 inspected by Colonel & others. Reached Tidworth at 8.30. Entrained 9.30 Mr Gray & Dumas coming with us. Dull day & cold travelling. Reached outskirts of London about 2 pm. Thought we were going there but turned off. Rest of day spent on journey. Nothing of event happened except 3 changes on 160 mile journey. Arrived B/sea 7.30 pm. Proceeded to Square in the town, formed up, checked, rationed, and then billeted at 48 Silcock St. with Mrs. Minter. Missed being put in with Norman as he went away with the 1st batch I being in the second.
Entry.78:
Spent all morning on Clothing board. Had gear checked by

20. Q.16 & then returned to billet. Mrs Minter having taken ill we found it necessary to find a new home. Got re-billeted at 122 Sydney Street & found there two of the old B. Coy men- Frank Ward and Jim Johnstone.

21. Sunday Rose 8.20. B/fast. Church parade 9.30. Church out 10.15. D’missed 10.30 am. Spent rest of day sewing amp; writing home & Mrs Linley and Mr. Highwood of Meaddows Bros; Frank & Flo.
Entry.79: 1st Day of training at B/sea. Trench work. Lecture in hall at 8.30 till 10.30. Marched from there out to training paddock & spent day wiring for Revetments. Marched back at 3.30. & went for mail. After tea went to pictures. Got first letters from Reg & Flo dated
Entry.80:

The Adjutant is expected up on deck at any minute. V.E.R.D.

15.11.16 S/S Marathon. At Sea.

Sender Norman F. Walker.

When the war broke out I was on a run between Sydney and the Marshall Islands. And on the seventeenth of August the Brunner caught us up and told us that war was declared between England and Germany, and that we were to proceed to Sydney as soon as possible with lights out at night as we had a valuable cargo of copra on board, and that the "Emden" was about.

VE.

RD. Linton Receiver.

S/S Marathon 16/11/16.

Sender. N.F. Walker.

We will arrive in Durban some time next week, I think and will have another good feed in a cookshop- V.E. R.D.

Receiver N.G. Linton

Sender B.T .Smith

When are we going to have another washing day as I have got several articles to wash. V.E.

Diary		Part 2.

Part 3 will be kept at the front & I will hand it over on my return on - (?)

Keep this safe & do not let it get separated

Noel

Diary. (2)
Entry.81: 85. Parade. 8 am. Marched out to trench works & put in day digging trenches. Very cold & glad of the hard work. No letters.
Entry.82: 86. (L) Parade 8 am. Lecture in hall on Revetments etc till 10. Marched out to Trench works & spent the day on hurdle making. Saw demolition of bomb-proof sheltes with 10 lbs of G.C with no serious result. Had a look over the old church in the dinner recess. Had hot bath at night at baths with Jim Johnstone. Received letters today from Ted, Cal, Madge & Mr Highwood of London. Spent evening writing etc.
Entry.83: 87. Parade 8 am. Lecture in hall on , Shelters etc. Marched to trench works & spent day in making hurdles Visited old church again. Wrote Highwood, Flo, Walter with letter to Bank. Sent keys to. Flo with Diary
Entry.84: 88. Parade 8 am. Very cold morning. Marched to works & carried on revetting etc Work inspected by General -. Left work at 2.45 Dismissed 3.15. Spent evening by fire reading & writing. Wrote to Dick.
Entry.85: 89. Parade 9 am. Route march till 10. Then inoculated by Dr Walrus who prolonged the agony somewhat. Went to Foresters Hall & got paid 30/-. Bought Gloves 6/6. Arranged for bike for next day. After dinner made for P.O. & on the way was grabbed by Sgt Wilson for duty. Marched to the & had to load rails on to lorry, with others. From there went to Station & put them on a truck. Finished up & posted Registered Packet of Diary & keys to Flo. Spent evening at home writing out job for Smith & Lectures. Got new boots. No mail as usual.
Entry.86: 90. Parade 9.30. Church as usual. Dry Sermon. Went for walk round Oyster Beds & The . After went for mail. None, as usual. After Dinner went out on bike with Frank Ward. Left home 1 pm. Returned 4 pm. Rode about 17 miles. Felt rather tired. Went out within 3 miles of Clacton–on-Sea. Had cup of tea at the Flag Inn. at St. Osyth. Then resumed ride. Very cold. Wore gloves, muffler, balaclava, mittens, Great coat & did not feel hot. Spent evening at home copying Lectures & writing diary.
Entry.87:
91. Parade 8 am. Lecture in hall. Marched to trench padk. & carried on with Comm. Trench work all day. Nice day. Snowed midday. Got cold after. Left 3 pm. No mail as usual. Stayed in at night & wrote. Mr Sparkes & read papers.

Jany/17.
Entry.88: 92. Parade by Lt. Col Elliott (Pompey) in Square. Then marched to parade Ground & went through several movements for him & proving satisfactory, marched to trench paddock. Had lecture on Wire Entanglements & put in about 2 ½ hrs at it. Snowing all time. Very cold & slow work. After dinner did bag revetting in trenches & found the change of work very welcome. Watched ice sliding in dinner hour on lake, near work. Work inspected in af’noon by the Colonel. Left at 3.30 for town & glad to be out of the cold. Went for mail & as usual- NONE. Made for home. Arrived there to stay for evening as usual. Spent after tea writing up lectures & diary. Several rumours current re leaving for France shortly. Wrote Billy Caldwell.
Entry.89:
93. Parade 8 am. Then to Works near church. Trench work & Barbed wire work all day. Caught fresh

cold in spite of precautions. Spent evening at home alone nearly dead with coughing & slunk away to bed with a hot lemon in one hand & a hankey in the other. Slept brokenly.
Entry.90: Rose as usual & paraded sorry I did not go "sick" as I felt weak amp; had a proper attack of the ‘Flue. However I carried on & longed for the long day’s end & by the time I reached billet was nearly beaten. Stayed in & had tea & then went & had a good hot bath & felt degrees better. Spent all day same as yesterday. Slept better. Got letter from Jim of
Entry.91:
Feb 2 Frdy 95 Parade 8. Robinson & self detailed by Mr Gray to write out leave passes for our Coy. While doing this Andrewathur came in & ordered us to our training, Sorry & sore

at losing our comfy job we left town at 10.am & walked out to works reaching there 35 mts later. Carried on in trenches till noon. Had dinner & then got on to hurry-up wire work. Spent evening by fire reading & eating Italian Oranges which I bought. Had Haircut. News of Hun Submarine Campaign reached here with usual comment & speculation as to USA attitude. Not frightened of the Hun business, the other a big ?
Entry.92:
Sty 95. Parade 9 am. Marched to Recn Ground & did Coy. Drill on the snow-covered ground for 2 hours. Then marched back to Square & d’missed about 11.30. Went for mail & got none. Got cover design for booklet from Woods & went to station to catch train to visit Colchester. Went with ted Luscombe, Frank Ward & Jim Johnstone in the 12.10 train & arrived there about

12.40 (same day). Met Herb Larsen outside station & the lot of us went & had a good dinner at Wright’s Restaurant which cost us 3/- each. After that we walked round the town & saw all the sights such as the Old Roman Wall, Guard Room, St Peters Church, The Old Roman Castle & Museum, Town Hall etc & bought a book of it all to send home to show what it is all like. After roaming round till dark & buying Cards etc we had a light tea & caught the 6.30 train for home arriving there about 7.15 p.m. after a good day. Herb Larsen at Barracks there learning a Physical Culture & Bayonet fighting, course. Expects to return to B/ling sea
Entry.93: Sndy 4. 96. Parade 9.30 Church. Spent rest of day in Billet writing home for mail on 8th. Sent book of Colchester to Flo and several p/cds home of same.
Entry.94: 97. Parade 8. Heavy Snow. Marched to Mine field thro snow. 4 miles. Very cold. Started work after lecture & worked all day thro snow. Spent evening writing. Had letter from Mr. O.G. Brooke dated 5/1/17. Answered it tonight. Also wrote Fearsley.
Entry.95: 98 Parade. Cold. Mining fields all day. Left there 2 pm for town. Dismissed 3 pm. Went to billet. Had Tea. Left again 5.30. 6pm marched to Church & did wire entanglements till 7.45 Retd to Town. D/missed at 8.15 pm. Went to billet & spent rest of evening writing mail to Mrs. Goold & others. Letter from Flo.
Entry.96:
99. Parade 8. Cold clear day. Went to Recn Gds for Jerks. Stayed there 45 minutes. Went from there to Mine fields. Spent day there. Arrived in town at 4.15. Got S.M. Herald & Bulletin

Wedy 7/2/17. 99 from Sydney. Don’t know who sent them. Spent night in billet after posting mail. Had letter from Ted dated 10/12/16 giving me first intimation I have had of the official news of Arthur Goold’s death. Felt better from cold today than I have for 2 weeks. Feet still sore & very tired.
Entry.97: 100. Parade 8. Rifle Drill till 9. Then to Mine field & spent day on mining as usual. Very cold day. Left at 3.15. Got letters from Walter, Jean, Cornie, Letter card from Flo from Matre & letter from Mr. Brooke from London. Had hot bath & spent evening reading & writing to Mr. Brooke & thanking him for his parcel.
Entry.98:
101 Parade 8 am. Robinson & I told off to write passes. Went to my billet & did the job. Left town at 11. Arrived Mine fields noon.

Had Dinner on arrival, such as it was- 2 pieces of dry bread with a piece of cheese between, the first lunch in the Central feeding scheme. Spent afternoon filling up shaft we had been working on all week. Also helped others to do the same. Retd town at 4 pm. Got letters from Ted & Tups. Had tea under the new scheme. Not as good as billet teas. Everyone dissatisfied with change in Messing arrangements. Hope to see an improvement in them soon. November Reinfs arrived here tonight. Bathed my feet after suffering from them terribly all the day long. Spent evening in billet reading etc.
Entry.99:
102 B/fast 7.20. Not bad. Retd to billet till 8.45. Parade 9. Went for route march. Then got pay 30/- also parcel (Xmas Gift) from Miss Mona Rowson of Mackay, Qland.

Wrote. Charlie Gray, Hugh Jennings, Miss Warren Matt O’Neill (Condolence)

Recd. 4 Letters from Flo. 

 1 " " Frank

	1 " " Miss Warren

	Bulletin from Frank

	Telegraph " Reg

Sat 10/2/17. Went to Q.H. & got stuff. Had good dinner. No mail today. Spent a/noon in billet writing & reading. Wrote to Mattie & Miss Rowson thanking her for parcel of Tobacco, Pipe, sweets, Shaving Soap, Cigarettes, envelopes, paper, pencil, Soap powder & condensed milk. All hands got a box of these things after being paid today. Had tea & spent evening at home writing & reading & the usual smoking. Feel much relieved for treatment of last night.
Entry.100:
103 Rose 8.15. B/fast in billet. Church parade 9.30. Mail after. Got 4 letters from Flo. 1 told of Arthur’s death. 1 letter each from Frank & Miss Warren. Also Bulletin & Telegraph from Frank & Reg. Spent part of a/noon in Rec. Room finding out about a lady here who is looking for me. Got her name- The Hon. Mrs. Bateman.

Sun 11/2/17. Had tea at Recn Room & retd to billet & spent evening reading & writing.
Entry.101: 104. Parade 8. Physical jerk lecture till 9. Marched to Mine field. Lecture on Sapping. Spent a/noon in Sap. Retd town 4. No mail. After tea men marched in body to R.E. Mess to complain of food to O/O. Went to Lecture (1) in Salvation Hall. Retd to billet at 7.15 & spent rest of evening by fire reading.
Entry.102:
105 Parade 8. Mine field 9. Task work Finished 2.15. Came home. Arrived town. 3.15. Went billet & cleaned up after Sapping all day. Had tea & being too tired did not go to Lecture No 2 on Lille front. Stayed in billet & read. Turned in early after supper. No letters today. Messing improved

2 Bulletins from Frank.
Entry.103:
S. M. Herald " Reg

Letter from Mattie

" " Lady Bateman.

Wed.14/2/17 106 Parade 8. Jerks till 9. Minefield 10. Task work in blind sap all day. Finished 2.45. Arrived town 3.50. No mail. Tea. Lecture 3. Billet where I spent evening by fire feeling tired. Turned in early.
Entry.104: 107 Parade 8. Minefield. Task on Blind Saps. Cut out 2. Arrived town 3.30. No mail. Had letter from Billy Caldwell from C/church. Had tea & went to billet & turned in early after supper
Entry.105:
108 Parade 8. Jerks till 9. Minefield all day. Carried sandbags all day. Heavy work. Saw mine exploded at 3.15. Left & got into town at 4.15. No Australian mail. Had bath. Spent evening in billet & had supper early & turned in really dead beat.

Recd Review of Reviews from Mr Brooke

" British Australasian " " "

Wrote Flo. No. 2.

" Ted No 2. Sent R & R & Guide of Colchester

" Nora & sent R & R & Colchester book

" Tups, Con & Joan in 1 letter.

" Mr. O.G. Brooke, London re papers

"	" C. Highwood "

"	Mattie.

"	 Mrs. Goold.
Entry.106: 109. Parade 8. Co. Drill till 10.15. D/missed 10.30. No mail. After dinner called on the Hon. Mrs. Bateman at B/lingsea Hall with Jim Johnson. Found her a dear old lady. Spent 1 ½ hrs there & had tea. Left 4.45. She is cousin on Mr Octavius Brooke. Invited us to Dinner Sunday 25/2/17. Had tea at Rec & retd to billet & spent evening reading.
Entry.107: 110. Parade 9.30 Church till 10.30 Walk till noon. No mail. Dinner. Spent rest of day in billet writing to Flo & the boys.
Entry.108:
112 Parade 8. Jerks till 9. Minefield 10. Carried water for lunch, tough job. Lecture on Breastworks till Dinner. Spent a/noon on B/work. Town 4.15 No mail. M/O today. Tea. Stayed at home all evening writing. 

Letter from Mrs Linley Dated 25/1/17.

Tues. 20/2/17. 113. In Guard of Honor to new O/C.

Parade 8. Minefields. B/works all day. Retd tired. 
 No 
 mail. Letter from Mattie. Stayed in billet & wrote letters.

Wed. 21/2/17 114 Parade 8. Jerks till 9. M/fields all day. B/works. Retd town 3.30. Tea. Parade 5.45. Task work at night. Trenches. 6’x 3’x 3’. Hard work. Finished the dark job at 9.30. Got into town 10.30. D- near dead. Had welcome supper & went bed. Ready for it after hard day. Posted mail.

Th. 22/2/17. 115. Parade 8. M/fields all day. Spent day in lectures on Demolitions. Did some exploding. Cutting rails with Detonation & Primer. Easy day. Went out & back with S.F.B. 
 Stay 
 Had tea & went to Concert in Rec. Hall. Got program to send Flo. Only decent item by Soldiers. 

Got Letters from Flo. 11-14/11/16 9/12/16. Clar 13/11/16 Matt O’N. 11/11/16 Walter 12/11/16 Bob 12/11/16. Little Jean
Entry.111:
116 Parade 8. Jerks till 9. M/fields all day. Good days work on B/works. Saw Girder broken by Guncotton. Saw proof of Souvenir. Left 3.30. Town 4.30. Tea. Pay 30/-. Retd to billet 7.30 & stayed in & wrote to Mrs. Linley. Feet much better tonight.

Sat.24/2/17 117. Parade 8. Coy Drill till 10.30. D/missed. Dinner. Spent rest of day-after bath- in moving billet to 71 New Street. Took till 9 getting straight. Had supper & tea in billet. Turned in 10.30. No mail today.
Entry.112:
118 Parade 9.30. Church till 10.45 Had dinner with Lady Bateman. Jim went too. Enjoyed it. Retd town & had kit inspection in Rec Gd. Retd billet & went

Wrote Clarice. Send Flo program concert.
Entry.113:
118 Rec hall for tea. Came home & spent evening in billet by fire & read.

Mon 26/2/17 119. Parade 8. M/fields. 9.30. All day on p & s & br/works. Good hard days work. Feet much better for soaking. Left 3.20. Town. 4.10 no mail. Went billet & tidied. Tea. Saw Mr Dumas & handed him £ 4/18/4 for Souvenirs. Retd billet & soaked feet & wrote & read spending all evening there practising for concert tomorrow night at Methodist School Hall.

Tues. 27/2/17 120. Parade 8. M/fields all day on B/works. Day extended till 4.30 instead of 4 & no Jerks as time available fr. training has had to be curtailed. Left for home 4. Town 5. No mail. Tea. Stayed in billet all evening till 7. Went to Concert in Wesleyan Hall. Did

Letters from Flo 22-29/12/16 8/1/17. Clar 11/1/17. Matt 9/1/17 Tups.
Entry.115: 120. 2 turns. "Gung Dihn", "Cuddle Down" & "Tommy Atkins" & "Naps Goodbye to his troops". Crowded audience. Mr Gray in the Chair. A great success. Retd home 10pm & had supper & retired.
Entry.116: 121. Parade 8. M/field all day on B/works. Left 2. Town 3.15. Tea. Task work on Comm. trench 3’x3’x6’ at night Good light. Did my task in good time & was among first away. Home 10.15. Had supper & bathed my poor feet & went to bed feeling almost dead.
Entry.117:
122. Parade 8. Church till 11 on on revetting a trench. Took it easy. 11 am. Went to M/field & saw 12 lbs of G/cotton exploded on M/Gun emplacement with little or no effect. Dinner. Church again & resumed job as before dinner. Left 4.30 after an

Wrote Reg Letter No. 3.

Wrote little Jean.

"	Flo No 3 letter.

Letter & papers from Mr. Brooke.

Th 1/3/17 122 easy day. Good mail. Tea. Spent evening in billet reading letters etc. Retired early. Feet very bad today after yesterday. First intimation of leave today. Granted 5 days from. 13/3/17 till 18/3/17. Great rejoicing. No extra money to be allowed us.
Entry.118: 123. Parade 8. Church all day on revetting. Easy day. Nice warm day. Left 4.30. Town 4.50. Got Souvenirs & handed some out after tea. Spent evening in billet reading & writing. No mail today. Sent concert programs to Floris.
Entry.119:
124 Parade 8. Minefield demolishing B/work. Left 10.30. D/missed 11.15. No mail. Bath. Dinner. Cleaned up & went for tea to Mrs Bateman. Pleasant time. Arrived billet 8.30. Supper & went to bed.

Wrote Highwood} 

"	Mr Brooke} London re leave.

"	Mattie}

"	Mrs Linley}

"	Thors.

"	Miss Deane

Letter from Miss Mc Nab. 28/12/16

"	"	Charlie Gray. 28/12/16

"	"	{Flo & Dance program dated 1/1/17.

"	"	{2 P/cds of Jenolan

Wrote to Miss Mc Nab.
Entry.120: 125 Parade 9.30. Church. No mail. Dinner. In billet all a/noon. Very cold. Tea in billet. Spent evening writing Aust. mail & London letters.
Entry.121:
126. Parade 8. Snowing & bitterly cold. Church all day revetting. 
 No mail.
 Mail. Stayed in billet all evening writing.
Entry.122: 127 Parade 8. Very raw cold & windy morning. Church all day. Little work as no sods available for revetting. Spent most of day in trenches shivering. Left 4 pm. No mail. Jim’s section went on London leave. 6 pm lecture in S.A. Hall by L/C Norton. 7.30 Rehearsal in New Church hall for big Concert on
Entry.123:
Don’t like having to go out in cold & wind. Feeling great tonight.

Letter from Flo. 14/1/17

"	" Mrs. Linley.

Wrote to Mrs. Spora.

Letter from Reg 18/1/17

"	" Flo. 18/1/17

Map of London from Mr. Brooke.

Wed.7/3/17 128 Parade 8. Very cold & windy. Church all day pumping out water from Dugout gallery & generally cleaning up. Too cold to work in open much. Spent day in trenches. Left 4.15. No mail. After tea posted Australian mail & spent evening in billet by fire reading.

Th 8/3/17 129. Parade 8. Nice bright & sunny morn. Great improvement on last 2 days. Church all day draining Dugout. Good days work. Mail. Tea. Stayed in billet all evening by fire reading & writing.
Entry.124:
130 Parade 8. Nice morning. Day proved cold snowing nearly all time. Church farm draining dugout all day. Wet & dirty job. Town 4.45 Mail. Tea. 6 pm went for pay. Got £ 4/10/- & paid 5/3 ½ fare to London. Retd billet 8. Spent rest of evening reading by fire.

Wrote Mr. Highwood

"	Mr. Brooke.

"	 Cis. Pritzler

Bulletin from Frank.

Wrote Mrs. Loughman.

"	Mr & Mrs. J. Clark.

Letter from Cal.
Entry.125:
"	" Flo. 20/1/17.

Sat 10/3/17 131. Parade 8. Church till 12. Town 12.30. Dinner. Paid usual visit to Mrs. Bateman. Tea. Bath. Retd billet 7.30. Stayed in all evening & wrote London & read.
Entry.126: 132 Parade 9.30 B/fast in billet. Church till 10.45. Mail. Got rest of Souvenirs. After dinner spent a/noon fixing up Souvenirs for post & cleaning regimentals for leave. Had tea at Recn. Room. Spent evening in billet writing & reading.
Entry.127: Parade 8. Raining hard. D/missed till 9. Fell in 9. Marched to Church. Still wet & after sitting under cover ½ hour came back to town & d/missed till 2. 2 pm lecture in New Church Hall on Camp arrangements. D/missed 3.20. 4. Mail. Issue of W/proof cape. Spent evening billet getting ready 4 leave
Entry.128: 134 Parade 8. Got passes for London & ticket Left by 10.20 train. Arrived Liverpool St 12.45. Caught tube to Chancery Lane & saw & had dinner w Mr Highwood. Left city 3pm for C/wood & met Mr Linley on his way out. Made way to 199 & met Mrs. L. Had dinner & spent evening at home. Found Mrs L very sick w flue.
Entry.129:
135 Rose 7.30. B/fast 9. Left home 10 w Mr Linley for London. Took 
 tube 
 train to Baker St. Got Motor bus to Marble Arch & Hyde Park & walked through city via Oxford St, Holborn, Cheapide to St Pauls. Went thro latter. Some place. Saw over Guildhall, Meat Markets & 
 Flood 
 Fleet St Viaduct. Old Bow St Church. St Bartholemews Church. St. Barts Hospital. Lunch at Lyons. Bk of England. Mansion Hse. T/gar Square. National Gallery. Museum.

Letter from Mr Brooke.

Letter from Mattie

"	" Ted. 14/1/17

Wed 14/3/17 135. Spent a/noon at Coliseum. Then met Mr L & called on Mrs. Forsyth. Retd home after a capital day & had dinner, spent evening at pianola & turned in at 11.45.
Entry.130:
136. Rose 8. B/fast 9. Left home 10. Caught bus from Crown at C/wood for Victoria Stn. Got off at Grosvenor Hotel & met Mr. Brooke there at 11. Went to Aust H.Q. & met Davidson who got my permit to visit Dovercourt. Went round Lambeth Bge & Houses of Plt, W/minster Abbey. Some church. Much historical interest. Saw Cromwell’s statue near H of P. Got bus along main Govt Dept route. Saw 10 Downing St, War Office, Admiralty, Foreign Office & all main places of interest.

Th. 15/3/17. Lunch. Went to see Oscar Asche in Chu Chin Chow. With Mr. Brooke. Great show. Had Coffee after & took bus to Marble Arch. Got bus from there home. Dinner & spent evening as last night.
Entry.131:
137. Rose. 9. B/fast. Left for town (London) 10 from 
 Crown 
 C/wood Stn with Mr. L. Went all round Embkmt & Monument & London Bge & wharves, Lunch. Did the Tower of London & met Mr. Brooke at Grosvenor at 3. I/duced Mr L to him. Set out thro Hyde Park, saw B/ham Palace, Bond Street. A/noon tea. Called on Mrs. Forsyth. Said Good-bye & made homeward arriving 6.45. Mrs L not too good. Spent e/ning at home. Jim Johnson left for front.
Entry.132: 138. Rose 8. Went walking with Mr L. Saw Lord Aberdeen’s Dollis Hill home where Gladstone used to spend his weekends. Caught train to Hendon & saw aero works. Came home. Dinner. Packed up & said Goodbye to Mr & Mrs. L & left for Liverpool St to catch 2.15 to D/court. Mrs L gave me parcel of eats. Arrived D/court & met Mattie there. & went to her home getting there 5.15. Mr. Oliver came home on leave for 4 days at 6 pm.
Entry.133:
139. Rose 8. B/fast. Mr O & I walked to Harwich & got my pass fixed up. Spent rest of day with Olivers & left for B/sea by the 5.4 arriving home at 8.30. in time for Supper.

Letter from Reg 18/12/17.

Wrote Jim. No.4

" 	Mr & Mrs Linley

" 	Mr Highwood

"	Mr. Brooke.

20/3/16

Posted Guildhall book to Jim.

"	Tower	 " " Flo.

"	Times to Jim

"	Souvenir to Charlie Gray.

"	"	 " Miss Mc Nab.

"	"	 " Mme Boult.

Wrote Flo No.4

"	Mrs Bateman

"	Mattie

"	Percy .Forsyth
Entry.134: 140. Parade 8. First after leave. Nice morn. Put on Draft. Got fitted out & passed thro necessary items such as M.I. etc. Lunch. Parade 2 in full kit for France. 17 of us not picked for draft & all my mates going. Felt out of it. Expect to go this week. D/missed 2.30 for a/noon. Parade 6.10 to go to stn w boys. Day turned out very wet. Put on picket at station. Saw boys off. Retd billet at 7.30. Spent evening at home writing.
Entry.135:
141. Parade 8. All day patching up trenches at Hall farm. Easy day. Got town 4.45. Dinner. Rang up Mrs. Linley. She was not too good. Retd billet & spent evening writing like hell all the time.

Sent Mr McLeod Souvenir.

Wrote " " re "

Letter from Mrs. Linley

"	" Mr. Brooke & papers.
Entry.136: 142 Parade 8. Hall farm all day. Very wintry. Snow, rain, hail off & on. Town 4.45 Tea. Called on Mrs Bateman in evening to say Au Revoir. Then went to rehearsal for Concert tomorrow evening. Had none. Retd billet & spent evening reading. No news as to draft leaving yet.
Entry.137: 143. Parade 8. Hall farm all day. Still wintry. Snow, hail & wind off & on all day. Town 4.40. Tea. Retd billet & dressed for Concert in Forrester’s hall. Did "Dandy V" & "Lichtenberg" (encore) well recd. Retd billet 8.45. Spent rest of evening there & retired at 10. No news of draft leaving.
Entry.138:
144. Parade 8. Hall farm all day cleaning up. Very cold Town 4.35. Tea. Bath. Got pay

Wrote Mr. Brooke

Wrote Mrs. Linley & sent pen to her.

Fri 23/3/17 144

£ 1/10/- & retd billet & stayed there all evening reading.
Entry.139: 145 Parade 8. Broke off & met Mr. Dumas at 9. at O.M. Met him again at 9.30 & helped him with list of items for Naval & Military Sports this a/noon on Rec. Ground. Dinner. Spent a/noon at Sports on Reporting Staff. Very much tame & muddled turnout, similar to Concert arrangements. Left at 5.15. Tea in billet. Rang up Mrs. Linley & returned to billet & spent evening reading. No news about draft yet.
Entry.140:
146 Parade 9.30. B/fast in billet. Church till 11. Home. Dinner. Read all afternoon. Tea at Recn Room. Home again & spent evening reading in billet. 

Card from Mrs. Linley.

Wrote Mrs. Linley farewell letter.
Entry.141: 147. Parade 8. Very cold & hailing. Went to ford with S.M.E & helped to put bridge over Colne River. Snowing & hailing all time. Left 2 pm for home for equipment for draft. Had mine & got tidied. Rang up Mrs. Linley. Tea. Spent evening in billet reading "Money Spider." Tea. 7.30. Went to Forresters hall to Prize Dis. for Sports. Did "Tommy Atkins" & "Devil May Care" as items on Concert program. Retd Billet 9. Heard draft is going tomorrow. Don’t know if I am on it. Wrote Mrs L. letter of farewell in anticipation.
Entry.142: 149. Parade 8. Only 3 men out of our section on draft. Rest came a gutser as all my cobbers with exceptn of 2 or 3 have gone. Feel very out of it today. Put on fatigues all day at Forresters hall washing up & cleaning the place with its usual once-a-week thoroughness. After tea rang up Mrs Linley & then said Au Revoir to boys going away tonight. Had toothache all day & decided to visit Dentist on the morrow forenoon. Retd billet & spent evening, in spite of jawache, reading. Went bed 9.30 & had very little, if any sleep, all night.
Entry.143:
150. Parade 8. Church farm till 10.30 when toothache got too bad to stand. Saw Sgt Hadley & got permission from

Wrote Mr. Brooke
Entry.144:
150. Major Gregson to go see the dentist. I did so & he decided that tooth was useless & I let him extract it. It had begun to abcess & my face was very sore. I longed for sympathy there being none here, & after having a cup of tea in billet for my lunch, I again set out to church well guarded against any chance of taking cold. After answering my name, Sgt Nobes told me to p.o.q. & I did so arriving home at 1.30. Shaved, washed my mouth out with P.O.P & then crawled into bed & slept for an hour or so awakening to a much more pleasant & healthy self than I was before. Sat by fire till tea. Tea. Rang up Mrs. Linley & retd billet & spent evening 

Letters from Mrs. Linley

Book 	"	"	" Who is responsible.

Letter from Mrs. Linley

Th. 29/3/17 150. reading & writing. Feel as well tonight as I did sick this morning. That was d- crook.
Entry.145: 151. Parade 8. Feeling good after physicing & absence of jawache. Nice sunny morning. Real Spring. Church all day revetting trenches. Took it easy. Retd town 4.45. Tea. 6. Lecture on war in S.A. Hall. 7. Bath. 8. Retd billet & spent evening reading "Who is Responsible" which Mrs. Linley sent me.
Entry.146:
152. Parade 8. Raining & hail hard. D/missed till 9.45. Fell in again & marched to church. Unloaded lorry of sand & not wanting to get wet being on draft, the Major sent C4 home. Dinner. Spent (dull) a/noon at home cleaning up boots etc.

Wrote Frank Letter No. 5.

"	Flo	"	" 5.

Sat 31/3/17 152 Went to Rec. for tea at 5. Retd. billet & stayed in all evening & read & wrote. Day ended dark & cold & threatening for the morrow.
Entry.147:
153. B/fast in billet. Steak, eggs, toast, etc. Parade 9.30. Church till 11. Had tea with Norman Walker & Ken Wardhough & then went for mail. Got parcel from Mrs. Linley containing Cake, Pork pie, Cigarettes, Sweets & a Gold-mounted Cigarette holder. Dinner. After dinner got kit ready for inspection which did not come off owing to severe weather conditions. Big fall of snow made everything mucky & as unlike Spring as is possible to imagine. After taking kit to Rec Gd came home & stayed there reading till tea time.

Letter from Mr. Brooke

"	" Mrs Linley.

Sun 1/4/17. 153. Tea. Had this in billet. Menu- Pork pie, toast & cake & tea. Good meal. Thanks to Mrs. Linley. Never went out. Stayed in billet reading & writing all evening being left at home on my pat lonesome, which I enjoyed as a change to the usual cackling of females who make the place their abode for slandering their fellow creatures.
Entry.148:
154 Parade 8. Cold & dull. Church trenches all morning. 

Raining off & on all time. Very mucky. Got fairly wet & not having change, being equipped for draft, Major Gregson let us go home as soon as we had lunch. Got to town 1 pm. Went to billet & cleaned up. Read till 4. Rang up Mrs. Linley. Tea. 6.30 Kit inspection. Retd

Letter card from Mrs. Linley.

Mon. 2/4/17. 154 billet 7 pm & spent evening there reading. Turned in 10.
Entry.149: 155 Parade 8. Ground covered with snow to 2" which thawed as day wore on & made slush everywhere. Church all day on trenches. Did hard work all day. Plenty of showers again today. Sunny off & on. Town 4.30. Rang Mrs. Linley. Tea. Retd billet & spent evening reading & writing. Bed 10. Heard we are off to port on 12/4/17. Believe it true.
Entry.150:
156. Parade. Lovely sunny morning. Church all day shovelling sand. Enjoyed the day’s work in the sun. Town 4.30. Rang Mrs. Linley. Tea. Spent evening in billet finishing "Daughter of Brahma"

Wrote to Mrs Linley
Entry.151: 157 Parade 8. Nice sunny morning. Church all day on trenches. Took things easy. Had photo taken with boys on lorry. Town 4.30. Application for London leave turned down. Terribly disappointed. Rang & told Mrs. Linley so, who was the same. Tried for leave for a motor trip on Easter Saturday in its place. Hope to get it. Pay day again at 6.30. Got £ 1/10/-. Then went for hot bath. Retd to billet & spent rest of evening writing.
Entry.152:
158. Parade 9. Wet & miserable. Church till 10.15. Then to billet. 11.30. Mail. No letters again. Dinner. Still raining. 2.30. Sun shining. Got bike & rode out to see Mrs Bateman & found her out. Rode round for an hour & then back to billet. 5. Went to meet Harold

Fri.6/4/17 158 Low to take him to tea at the Methodist Church & Concert after. Did "Not Understood" & "Man was made to Mourn" on a/c of it being a sacred affair. Spent a nice evening on the whole & returned to billet at 11 after being at Holloway’s for supper.
Entry.153:
159. Parade 8. Did not go. Took Ford Car with Walker, Low, Noble, Jim McKay, Willshire from village pump at 8.15. Nice sunny day. Went right to Ipswich near Colchester. Arrived there 9.30. Spent morning in Ipswich seeing churches, Wolsey Gate, Old House, etc. Dinner 12.30. Splendid feed. Got car again & went out to Eye (21 miles each way) & looked over chief places of interest. (Got post cards & book to send to Flo.) Left Eye 4 for Colchester. Arrived there 5.15. Had Tea, ham & eggs.

Letters from Flo 21-28/1/17

"	 " Mrs Linley

Papers from Mr Brooke.

Book "Krupps" from Mr Linley

" "Soul of France" "

7/4/17 159. After tea went to theatre & saw "In the Bione Days of Old", comedy. Had to stand but enjoyed it. Left Colchester at 9.15 by the car for home. Had good run over in the moonlight. Arrived home 10. Had really enjoyable day the whole lot costing about 30/-.
Entry.154:
160. Parade 9.30. 
 Church till 11.
 Dinner. Went & saw Mrs Bateman with Walker. Tea at Rec. Went to church at night to Meth. Retd billet at 9 & turned in 10. Morning Dental & med inspection for draft.
Entry.155: 161. Parade 8. No holiday. Church trenches all day. Retd town 4. Tea. Went to Mrs Salmon’s. Social in evening

9/4/17 161 Had good time. Did "Benedick on Love" from "Much Ado about nothing. "Seven Ages of Man" & "Cuddle Down". Well received. Over at 10. Went back to Salmon’s & left at 11 for billet.

10/4/17 162 Parade 8. Church all day. Snow & hail on & off all day. Town 4.15. Rang Mrs. Linley. Spent evening in billet writing & getting photos & books ready for mailing.
Entry.157:
163. Parade 8. Church farm all day cleaning up. Left 3.45. No mail. Tea. After sent kit bag to Linley’s, also mail to Australia. After that went to Holloway’s with Walter Willey to say Good-Bye. Retd. Billet 10 & turned in. Rang up Mrs. Linley this a/noon.

12/4/17. 164 Parade 7.45. Cold. Went to Rec Gd to hear D.C.M. Verdict read on prisoner. Put on draft for France. D/missed. 9. Parade 10.30. Inspection. D/missed. Dinner. Parade 2. Inspn by Major Cutter. D/missed. Rang Mrs. Linley. Called & said good-bye to Holloway’s. Tea. Parade 6.10. Marched to Store for rations. Harold Lord left behind with Noble. Got train at 7.25 for London. Arr. Liv. St. 10.15. Marched thro city to London Bge Stn Met Mr Brooke who had followed us from Liv. St. Gave me book of poems & box of peppermint creams. Did not see Linley’s as we were not at stn. in time being late. Rang them up from Station & said good-bye at 11.30. Went into waiting room. Left at 2.45 for Folkestone by special. Arr. there 5.30 Went to billet & slept till 8. B/fast. Wash etc. Spent morning walking round & writing in Reg. Rooms.

23/4/17 Flo. No.6

 " Wrote Mrs. Linley

13/4/17 165 & sitting in & enjoying the sun with Norman, Herb & Walter.

14. Folkestone to Boulogne. Camped in 1 blanket hill 12 in tent.

15. Left Boulogne 11 am for Etaples. Arr 3.30.

16. Sun. Church. Wet all day.

17. Musketry. Fine.

18. Gas School. Wet.

19, 20, 21, 22, 23, 24, 25} Etaples. Cook fatigues. Others at Bull Ring. Anzac Day. Sports at Bull. Ring 

26/4/17. Left Etaples with Reins 15th Co. 5th Div. for Albert. Arr there 3. Anzac camp for night. Went round Albert. Saw Cathedral etc.

27/4/17. 179. Left Albert camp for Mametz Engrs camp. Arr. there 2 pm. Went to hut & spent rest of day at camp & over ruins of Mametz & then at Concert in Y.M.C.A. good show. 

28/4/17. 180. Attached to No 2 Sec. 15 Coy. Spent day in hut. a/noon. Walked round ruins with Herb.

29/4

30/17. Spent time round Mametz camp on odd jobs. Went all over M ruins & 1st Some B/field with Herb.

May

1, 2, 3, 4} Spent time training & doing fatigues for Sports & show

Went to Sports. Tame. Too hot in sun. Came back & lay down in hut

5. Went on fatigues to Sports at Pozieres

Wrote Misses Holloway.

May 5 187. making tables & counters. Bad head. Trip out in limber did not improve it any. Not having lunch set out to walk back. Arr. camp 1.30 hot & tired & slept till tea time.

Sun May 6. 188. Inspecn & d/missed all day. Windy. Spent day in hut & washing etc.

 Wed
 8 Wet. Did nothing but clean equipment.

Wed. 9. Left Camp Mametz 7.15 for Bazentin Circus where we travelled by A.L. R. to Bapaume. Breakdown on way. Saw 2 D coming out. Dinner at Aviation Reserve. Left 1.15 on road for Vaulx. Arrived there 4 pm & camped on hill in dugouts behind a 6 " how. By which gave me a first idea of what artillery fire was like. Had good sleep.

Th. 10. Rose 7. Fritz got busy soon after b/fast & keep on all this day blazing at the

" Walter No 7.

Th 10. battery on our port. About 4.15 he started shelling 1 camp. All men ordered out to open ground. Shell got 9 men killed & 8 wounded in pioneers. opp. our dugouts. Things so hot Major Greenaway ordered us further on on the road to a pos. ahead of the batteries. An old ruined factory where we spent 1 evening in peace & slept well on a concrete floor. The first experience of being under shell-fire was not too pleasant to me.

Fri 11. Spent day in new quarters making things gen. comfble. I spent day on Kitchens No 1 & 3 sections went to the line. Fritz still busy putting shells into A.M.C. tents a/cing for 23 men killed & wounded. In evening wrote letters home & London. Turned in early & the R.G.A started a heavy barrage on Fritz in Bullecourt. Sounded like a

Fri 11/5/17 194 battle between titanic forces to see who could make the biggest noise. Slept well.
Entry.158: Rose 6.30. Nice day, washed & had b/fast. Boys came back fr. line all O.K. Reported gaining of objective Duncan Woolley dead.
Entry.159: Rose 6.30. Nice day. Fritz still busy. Worked all day on filling crater in Circus at Vaulx & 4.30 started on march to Farrieul. 3 ½ m. Very hot & tiring. Had to catch up owing to having left box respirator on work. Nearly dead when I arrived at 2nd halt. Had some soda water & picked up a bit. Glad to get to billet in big stable away from the roar of howitzers.
Entry.160:
197 Rose 6.30. Gave blanket in. Marched to Vaulx & went on with crater. Saw Box on with aircraft. Most exciting. Left 3.30 & got wet to skin coming home in rain.

"Times" from Mr Brooke

Wrote Mr. Brooke (for tools)

"	Mrs Linley
Entry.161: 15/5/ 196. Rose 6.30. Same work in Vaulx all day. Paid £ 1/9/4.
Entry.162: Rose 6.30. Wet. Vaulx all day on repairing roads. Fritz quiet.
Entry.163: Rose 6.30. Wet. Do	Do	Do Bath.
Entry.165: Rose 6. B/fast. 8. Marched to old billet at Vaulx & got pos. in cellar. Arr. 9.15. Fritz putting few h.e. shells over near road. Went to Res. Sun. R & did work on d/outs.
Entry.166: Rose 6. B/fast. Went to Res. D/outs all day. Nice day. Nothing unusual. Fritz quiet. Put some shells close to billet in early hours.
Entry.167:
Rose 7.30. Parade 9.45. Marched to Farrieul in full pack. Got wet on way. Arr. 10.45 am.

May Tues 22. 205 Rose 7.30. B/fast 8. Inspn. 9. Wet day. Nothing doing pending break in weather. Slept on wire bed. Good-o. All sorts of furfies about moving to God knows where.

Wed 23. 206. Rose 7.30. Still at Farrieul. 9 am. Pde. Did Judging D/ance till 11.30. D/miss. Spent a/noon washing & watching cricket match on grounds. Nice day. First fine one for 3. No mail. Turned in early.

Th. 24. 207. Empire day. Rose 7.30. Nice morning. 9. Parade. Route Mch to Bapaume. 9.40 Broke off. Went for walk with Herb among the ruins of the city, Saw Cemetery. One of the best sights yet. Retd. Billet 11.30. A/noon. Spent rest of day playing cricket on Res. Gd. Playing No 1. Got beaten badly. After tea saw football match & turned in early after some supper.

Letter from Flo. 1, 2, 3.

"	"	Walter, Ted, Jeanne, Connie, Aileen, Lily, Cal, Matt, Jim

Wrote No 8 Cal

"	" Flo. (Forget me nots)

Letter from Flo 8/3/17.

Fri. 25 208. Rose 7.30. Lovely morning. 9 am Parade. Did apron wire drill in fields. Very hot. 1.30 Did some work on stage for Concert tonight. 6 Concert. Good band Music. Open air affair. Fairly good items considering. I did Gunga Dhin. Did not expect it. Made up my mind not to. Herb put my name on list unknown to me. Fairly well received. Hard work doing it in open air. Turned in 10.

Sat 26. 209. Rose 7.30. Nice morning. Fritz aeroplane brt down by gunfire at 5. Did not see it but heard firing. 9. Parade. Did barbed wire work in fields. Among the exempt, having done same y/day.

Sun. 27 210. Rose 7.20. Nice morning. Parade 9. Route March 6 miles thro’ Achiet le Grande & neighbouring country. Tho’ tedious I rather enjoyed it. A/noon. Equipment inspn.

May Sun 27 210. Spent rest of a/noon fixing Herb’s bed etc. After tea went to 20 D Concert. Real good show. Posted letters home.

Mon 28 211. Rose 6. Nice morn. 9. Parade. Spent morning at Section & Rifle Drill. Spent a/noon in cool talking. 6 Went to Concert 20th Battn. Good show. Enjoyed it.

Tues. 29 212. Rose 6. Dull morning but fine. 9. Parade. Morning Rifle Drill & route march. A/noon. Cricket. 5. Went to Concert. Same place, same people. Good show. Saw "Major’s mistake."

Wed. 30 213. Rose 6. Drill morning. 2. Parade. Route march. Bath. Tea. Concert.

Th. 31. 214 Rose 6.30. Drill morning. 2 Parade. Pay £ 1/9/4. Spent a/noon washing dirties etc.

Entry.173: 214 Tea 5. Went Concert. Repeat show almost. Good.
Entry.174: 215 Rose 6.30. Parade 8.30 Nice morning. Went out digging trenches. A/noon 3. Sports Pde Tea 5.30. Evening Saw football & had walk round generally.
Entry.175: 216. Rose 6.30. Parade 8.30. Did not go. Had boots mended a/noon. 3. Parade for Sports. Got old mail & read it with relish.
Entry.176: 217. Rose 6.30. Parade 9. Full mchg order. D/missed for day a/noon watched Cricket matches. Spent evening writing & wandering thro’ Mory ruins with Herb in search of souvenir material.
Entry.177:
218 Rose 6. Parade 8.30. Went out to work on trenches till 12.30.

Entry.178: 219. Rose 6.30. Pde 9. Route March to Bancourt & back – 6 m. in full pack. Very hot & tiring in sun. A/noon off. Spent lying about. Concert after tea. Fritz put few bombs down about 9.30. Helped to fix bike.
Entry.179: 220 Rose 6.30. Pde 8.30. On barbed wire work out near trenches. Easy morning. A/noon spent riding round on bike looking for eats & resting. Herb busy making dinner gong souvenir.
Entry.180:
221 Rose 6.30. Pde 8.15. Marched to Bancourt & did fatigues on Sports Gd for show on Saturday. Hard work for such a hot day. Saw Walter Willey there. Spent a/noon at sport practice. Things fairly quiet.

Entry.181: 222 Rose 6. Pde 7.45. 4 mile route march. 11 Bath Pde 2. Fatigues cleaning up around billet. Went to Baupaume baths for disc & then around the town on bike to see ruins. Spent rest of day resting & lolling around. News of Ypres battle to hand.
Entry.182: 223. Rose 6.30. Pde 9. Lecture on Lewis Auto. Gun. Sports in a/noon. 15th did well. Did not go over. Stayed & helped Herb with souvenir. Spent after tea hunting round for souvenir material & watching shooting on range. Drivers came to billet 11 & kicked up Hell’s delight. Nearly a fight with Mollineaux.
Entry.183:
224 Rose 7. Pde 8.30. Out wiring all morning. Spent a/noon washing clothes as we expect to shift out in day or 2.

Entry.184: 225. Rose 7. Wet on a/c of big storm. Pde 9. Did knots & lashings till 11. D/missed. Expect to shift at any time now. Went to Concert.
Entry.185: 226. Rose 6.30. Pde 8.30. Out wiring all morning. A/noon off. Saw cricket match after tea. Wrote letters till dark.
Entry.186: 227. Rose 6.30. Very sick w headache & bilious attk in spite of having taken pills. Got better after B/fast. Went into Baupaume for Dental. Have to go Friday. a/noon off. Spent time washing clothes. After tea read letter & papers.
Entry.187: 228 Rose 6.30. Nice morng. Pde 9. Did demolitions all morning A/noon off. Nothing to report. Saw 15th Beaten by 14th at Rugby eng. at Farrieul
Entry.188: 229. Rose 7. Nice morn. Pde 9. Set out 8.30 for dentist in Bapaume & got temp filling. Retd. 12. a/noon off Went to Verey Lights at night. Had bath in a/noon.
Entry.189: 230 Rose 7. Hot day. Pde 9. Trestle practice all morning. a/noon off. Leaving ‘morrow for Bouzincourt.
Entry.190: 231 Spent morn pkg up. Pde 12.45. Left Farrieul for Bapaume. Entrained 3. Arr Bouzincourt 7.15 very tired after hot & dusty 5 mile march. Turned in & was glad of the chance.
Entry.191:
232. Pde 9. Felt off. Did Coy Drill for 1 hour then set out for swim. Had it. Nice. Got lost on way back. Arr. camp 1.15 dead beat. Very hot. New place rather pleasant.

Mon 18/6/17

Seems strange being in a place not battered with war’s terrors.

Tuesday 19/6/17 233 Rose 6.30. Dull & Thundery. Pde 9. Did Coy drill till 11.15 D/m for rest of day. Leaving here for Corbey on the morrow.

Wed 20/6/17 234. Rose 6. Pde 9. Left Bouzincourt for Corbey via Ribemont & Mericourt. Nice day for marching. Did so till 12. Had nice rest in Ribemont- & dinner- & then set out on last stage of Journey at about 1.15 Arr Corbie 3 pm. Gd billet.

Th. 21/6/17. 235 Rose 6. Pde 8. On Somme River all day below Corbie on Pontooning. Rather nice day. Spent evening writing in billet

Entry.280: 321. Rose 3 am. Fell in 3.45. Caught motor lorry out to work in front of Ypres. Had to make culverts for tanks to cross. Retd10.30. Had b/fast. Had rest of day off & spent time putting iron roof on our dugout making it much more comfortable. Had visit from John at 11.30 just before he went into the line as reserves in the coming stunt.
Entry.281: 322. Had day off till 2. Fell in & marched out to Shrapnel Corner. Went out with party to fill in crater in Zillebeke road. Came back & returned to camp for night. Saw Fritz attack balloons & drive down 6 occupants in parachutes.
Entry.282:
323. Day off till 5. 
 Men went to Hooge on job doing roadwork.
 Had Call

Weekly Herald Mrs. Linley

Fri 21/9/17 323. from Norman Walker on his way back from the line. Spent most of day on dugout, putting on door etc. Went out at 5.30 thro’ Hellfire corner on to ridge beyond. Got into hun barrage & stayed in trenches while it lasted. Saw balloon come down. Saw our barrage go over. Worked on Dugout till 11.15 & set out for home arriving there 1 am tired out & utterly exhausted. Slept as soon as I lay down & did not awaken until John called at 8.30 Saturday.

Sat 22/9/17 324 John called & had b/fast on me. He went home later. After lunch I went over to his camp to see him. Had day off on a/c of last night’s work.

Sun 23/9/17 325. Left Billets for Zillebeke Road on line work. Arr. 3.30. Had tea & set

Sun 23/9/17 325 out to fix up an R.E. Dump on the Hooge heights. Easy work. Started back about 9 & after losing way arr. home at 11.

Mon 24/9/17 326. Set out at 9 for Hooge again to load pack mules. Fritz shelling hard as blazes on roads. Waited hour or more for halt in shelling. No safe place anywhere. Got going about 10.30 & after loading set out with them to advanced dump. Took stuff off & set out back for home. Arrived there 2 pm, knocked up & shaken. Stripped off & had bath in shell hole & felt much refreshed after it. Spent rest of a/noon in dugout resting. Weather perfect.

Entry.284: 327. Rose 6. Could sleep no longer thro’ the bombdmt. He made it willing. Did nothing all morning but had sleep in dugout. A/noon. Warned for duty at night. Told we were to go to front line as road party to mark out road thro’ Polygon Wood after
Entry.285: wave had gone thro’ so that supporting troops would know the track to follow. I was made a picket carrier. Did nothing all a/noon, but warned for 1.45 am in morning in battle order. Got things ready for the job. Examined Gas masks. Put Diary in O/coat.
Entry.286: 328. 1.30. Rose & had tea. 2. Fell in & marched out to front line. Got there about 4. Guide took us to wrong sectn. Went to find right place. Did not return. Barrage
Entry.287: 328 opened 5.45. Infantry moved forward. Our gunfire sounded terrible. Counter artillery opened early. One of 1st shells struck rear of our trench killing Fase, Urquhart, McGowan & wounding Bill White, Jack Parker & Scotty Irvine. Some of men went for aid. Others left at intervals. Hilton & I agreed to stay with & tend the lads. We waited from 7 till 10.30 for aid. None came. Sent Irvine away with wounded party going back. Shell came between 10.30 & 10.45 wounding me & as far as I was able to see killing Hilton. When I was able I got up & looked for aid. Saw none. Met Walter Willey who got aid for me, knew or remembered nothing from then till I awoke in Liverpool Merchants Hospital, Etaples in a cot feeling pretty sickly.
Entry.288:
328. Admitted with R. Eye destroyed. Gassed, fractured rib & several body wounds. Condition serious.

27-28/9/17. 330 Don’t remember much but suffering.
Entry.289:

30-19/10/17 351. Improved gradually & then began to fall off. Dr. examined me & found abcess on fractured rib. Told me he would operate & that it would make a great change in my condition.

Entry.321:
392. Much better. Good night. D/rea all O.K. Had side washed out. Spent a/noon writing.

Wed. 28/11/17 393. Feel great. Doctor said I could get up & sit by fire for a while. Greatly elated at the idea of it. Moore failed to post Mrs. L’s letter. Very annoyed. Slept most of morning.

A/noon. Spent in writing. After tea. Got up & sat by fire for an hour. Felt very weak but enjoyed it. All hands pleased to see me up. Had good smoke today.

Thur. 29/11/17. 394. Had splendid night. Feel very well. Got parcel of lovely shoes f Miss. L Brooke. Got up after tea.
